questions.question_text: Which ECC Queue message contains the XML payload returned from the MID Server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This guide says it is D.
https://www.servicenow.com/community/itom-articles/build-your-own-acc-v-inventory-module-check-definition/ta-p/2368617

Selected Answer: D
Once the Check Type is defines you need a check definition that define the way of querying the end-device. This could be done with scripts, commands or with the build in OSQuery (https://osquery.io/). ACC-V uses OSQuery for other data detection, and is maintained by the Agent. 

The good thing is that there is a predefined Check Definition to run OSQuery (util.osquery.agent) that you can take inspiration from.

Selected Answer: D
The Disco training has a slide which states: Check Definitions executes the osquery command on agents. verbatim.. I'm suggesting D.

I wanted to make a correction. I found the answer in Module 7 of the lab. If you watch that module at the portion where it talks about Check Definitions, it says word for word "executes the osquery command on agents." and "osquery commands are used to gather specific attribute details..."
That being said the correct answer is actually D. Check Definitions

comments.content: The answer is D not C.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I also believe it is C

Selected Answer: C
Could be C

Check site number 2 in the link
https://www.servicenow.com/content/dam/servicenow-assets/public/en-us/doc-type/resource-center/data-sheet/ds-itom-acc.pdf

comments.content:
ACC also supports
OSQuery, allowing you to query hosts and run remediation commands on
demand or from ServiceNow workflows using the Automation Engine spoke
available on the ServiceNow Store.

questions.question_text: Which of the following executes the osquery commands on agents to gather attribute details from a CI?

choices.C: All the necessary Range Sets are installed in the base installation of Discovery.
choices.A: Range Sets are the only way to have more than one IP Range defined within a Discovery Schedule.
choices.D: Range Sets provide flexibility in management and identification of known networks for simplicity of administration.
choices.B: Range Sets show the number of IPs in a subnet.

questions.question_text: What is the advantage of Discovery Range Sets?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
For Infrastructure
computer_system is the only Temporary Variable

For Application
computer_system & process this 2 are mandatory Temporary variable

So Correct Answer is - Infrastructure

Selected Answer: A
I am just looking at the variable on my PDI right now after running the discovery pattern for the iTunes application. Therefore i would go with A.
